Content: This is our 4th visit to Novotel Nusa Dua, Bali. We were very happy to stay there. The environment is friendly, comfy, and very nice for family. Kids love  the beach then from beach they move to the pool.  I myself and my husband love to shop balinese clothes,  dresses, shorts or jumpsuits. All of them are pretty with affordable price at shops beside the hotel. There are also many convenient stores around the hotel. If too lazy to walk outside the hotel, the foods in Square Rest  and cake shopp are yummy and delicious. They told us that their foods are free of MSG. Ooo my goodness... what a place.... then what I love too is their wash machine..  We just put out clothes inside..leave them for some hours.. taa..daa.. they are clean and almost dry... I need not worry about our clothes for stay any longer.☺Our love for Bali..Sarinah

Late afternoon time the water goes way out and it doesn't look nice. Late morning onwards when the sun comes out and water is still close is the best time to come here.

Content: WATER BLOW: nice but, depending on weather conditions, you might have to be patient if you want to get "the" shot so plan to stay there a little while if pictures/video is important to you.PRIVATE BEACH (FREE!): my wife and I stumbled upon a nice, deserted and almost virgin beach there. On the way to the Water Blow, get off the path a little before the Water Blow when you see a little temple between the trees to your right. There you will find a little private beach. We stayed there 2 hours and had the whole place to ourselves.
review: water blow nice depend weather condition might patient want shot plan stay little picturesvideo important youprivate free wife stumble upon nice desert almost virgin way water blow path little water blow see little temple tree right will find little private stay 2 hour whole place

Content: Nusa Dua are the best beaches I saw on Bali. Nusa Dua is all about beach walking, sunbathing, swimming or water sports. Walking along this beach in the evening is very relaxing.
review: nusa dua best beach saw bali nusa dua walk sunbathe swimming water sport walk along even relax

Content: We stayed at the Ayoda hotel for 1 week and it was excellent. The sun beds are right on the beach and the sand is soft and white. The water is crystal clear in the mornings and can be a little cloudy by the afternoon (I would say due to the tides/swell). The beach is kept very clean, and well maintained. There are little to no waves on the beach, which offer amazing swimming, even for the most novice swimmers. Will definitely be back in the not to distant future.
review: stay ayoda hotel 1 week excellent sun bed right sand soft white water crystal clear morning little cloudy afternoon say due tidesswell keep clean well maintain little wave offer amaze swim even novice swimmer will definitely back distant future

Content: If you visit bali, dont miss this place!!!!!Nice place with clean and good view.You can enjoy this place with family, couple, or solo.
review: visit bali dont miss placenice place clean good viewyou enjoy place family couple solo

Content: Lots of water sport actitvities going on, met few locals who were extremely friendly. Just sit by one of the numerous shacks /  restaurants on the beach and have a lazy lunch and a drink. Beach is shallow and you can go to a far distance even if you are not a swimmer.
review: lot water sport actitvities go met local extremely friendly sit one numerous shack restaurant lazy lunch drink shallow go far distance even swimmer

Content: Had some nice leisure time with family at nusa dua beach. The rain made it more interesting. Highly recommended for visit.
review: nice leisure time family nusa dua rain make interesting highly recommended visit

Content: Definitely the better place to go in Bali the rest of them were not great. As soon as we arrived here it was calm no cab drivers hassling you well a couple at the front but that was all. The beach was bliss nice cafes not over populated and really pleasant we got to swim in the ocean. No Rubbish at this beach which was great as the others in Bali let it down.great little bar you don’t need to take too much as it’s all there. It was clean and well kept. Loved the fact security were there it filters out the crap. Worth a visit.
review: definitely well place go bali rest great soon arrive calm cab driver hassle well couple front bliss nice cafe populate really pleasant get swim ocean rubbish great others bali let downgreat little bar dont need take much clean well keep love fact security filter crap worth visit

Content: It was a very pretty beach.  although very shallow.  It was great watching the local fishers using the schools of black tip reef sharks to locate the fish.
review: pretty although shallow great watch local fisher use school black tip reef shark locate fish

Content: The better beaches in Bali as most of these beaches are maintained by the international resorts located along the beach.Clean and low waves beaches as the beach should be sheltered, as we see waves from a distance but never hit the shore. The sands are soft and white. Good for children.
review: well beach bali beach maintain international resort locate along beachclean low wave beach shelter see wave distance never hit shore sand soft white good child

Content: Quite surprised as to how average this long flat windy beach was. No feel of paradise .  a flat beach.
review: quite surprised average long flat windy feel paradise flat

Content: The view here is breathtaking and the waters are clean. Waves can be strong and choppy though. There is water sports available here, such as para sailing.

Content: The Nusa Dua beach is a gorgeous white sand beach with plenty of water sports. It is safe for children to swim however there are a few hawkers around (not unusual for Bali). Lots and lots of weddings when we were there, seemed a little bit like a 'one size fits all' approach to weddings with couple after couple trekking down the pier for photos. That said, it was entertaining to sit and watch after recently getting married at the unique and quiet Komune resort. Loved the beach however and would defiantly recommend a visit.
review: nusa dua gorgeous white sand plenty water sport safe child swim hawker around unusual bali lot lot wedding seem little bit one size fit approach wedding couple couple trek pier photo say entertaining sit watch recently get marry unique quiet komune resort love defiantly recommend visit

Content: This beach has an amazing walk trail passing many great hotels.We stayed at the Sofitel and enjoyed the walk. The pictures tell the story.
review: amaze walk trail pass many great hotelswe stay sofitel enjoy walk picture tell story

Content: beach was  very pleasant and if yu r fan of water sports, then this is the place for all the water sport activity.
review: pleasant yu fan water sport place water sport activity

Content: Just an average beach, nothing special. Not too clean. Would recommend other beaches like Pantai Pandawa, that is only 10 minutes away and is more attractive. If you are looking for something more remote, with less crowd, then Green Bowl would be more suitable, it's only 15 minutes away from Nusa Dua.
review: average nothing special clean recommend beach pantai pandawa 10 minute away attractive look something remote less crowd green bowl suitable 15 minute away nusa dua

Content: I'm just walking around near my hotel, so i just want look beach, And woww !!, It's so beautiful place ever And ever 🙌
review: im walk around near hotel want look woww beautiful place

Content: clean beach, soft sand, free of rocks! Loved it! But the bars and beach clubs there are definitely catered to tourists, at a higher price of course!
review: clean soft sand free rock love bar club definitely catered tourist higher price course

Content: This beach is beautiful, very clean, you don't get hassled by sellers every 5 minutes, lots of water sports if you want, call into any of the restaurants along the beach for a meal or a drink, an enjoyable walk along the boardwalk (this is up around the Westin resort)
review: beautiful clean dont hassle seller every 5 minute lots water sport want call restaurant along meal drink enjoyable walk along boardwalk around westin resort

Content: Great spot for families to stay if you want to relax. Not the best spot for the cheap shopping or cheap massages that most people come for. Here, you will pay a little higher price than in Kuta area but it's a clean sandy beach.
review: great spot family stay want relax best spot cheap shopping cheap massage people come will pay little high price kuta area clean sandy

Content: Clear crystal aqua waters. water sports are great. you can cycle the whole BTDC area. fantastic. Excellent place you will come agin and again
review: clear crystal aqua water water sport great cycle whole btdc area fantastic excellent place will come agin

Content: The sand was ok. Indonesian is a populous country, so there is a lot of detritus in the sea. They had beach cleaners doing there best, but compared to Hawaii, or the Caribbean, its not that inviting so swim in. OK for sunbathing.
review: sand ok indonesian populous country lot detritus sea cleaner best compare hawaii caribbean invite swim ok sunbathing

Content: On photographs this beach looks like it is white and powdery like the ones found in Cuba, Mexico and Dominican but sadly we were disappointed to find a darker grainier sand and definitely needed sea shoes as my youngest son trod on an urchin on first day of our holiday and had to have several black small spines removed with tweezers.Looks so different when the tide goes out.
review: photograph look white powdery one find cuba mexico dominican sadly disappointed find darker grainier sand definitely need sea shoe young son trod urchin first day holiday several black small spine remove tweezerslooks different tide go

Content: While we were there the beach at the Grand Nikko was closed most days due to strong rip along the beach front.

Content: Not so nice beach. Great for strolling but not for swimming. Low tide during late afternoon for instagram pictures

Content: I was in some beaches in Bali but I think this one is the nicest and calmest to swim ,was staying  a bit far (about 16 km+) but almost every day I was coming here!!!!!

Content: Stayed at the Melia. The beach was perfect for our kids 3, 9 and 11. Very shallow at low tide. Nice atmosphere. Good service at the Level.
review: stay melia perfect kid 3 9 11 shallow low tide nice atmosphere good service level

Content: Fabulos beach no shale or sroney beach sand sand sand .very shallow only up to waist high for a great way out only then does it get deeper.not alot of fish about so not great for snorkling gotta get a boat to take you out further for that.cafe is great have your food at the bar we found it got cold by the time it took to get to the beach at the cafe you got good food drinks ciggies some snacks .food was always fresh cooked from what i could see and had .never had bali beli .toilets basic :but unisex as the day goes on they do smell and dont get cleaned regulary.enough.Sunbeds get there early only 100 idr for two all day .prices go up as the beach fills .beach vendours once told no they didnt bother us again .massage highly recommend it yiann also known as numder 5 amazing lady 200idr for full body best money spent all holiday .Taxis get the local blue or blue bird dont get the others your likely to get ripped off the bar will even get you one.

Content: Great great beach if you're after some nice clean golden/white sand away from the hustle and bustle of bali. we stayed at The Mulia in nusa dua and the hotel has a private guest only Beach right by the beach! Excellent, it was clean peaceful beautiful photo worthy beach! loved it x
review: great great youre nice clean goldenwhite sand away hustle bustle bali stay mulia nusa dua hotel private guest right excellent clean peaceful beautiful photo worthy love x

Content: Its a beautiful beach with blue skies and lot of activities to do. One day is probably good enough to complete all the activities. We just loved it there. We had so much fun with family. There were hoards of visitors trying out various activities at the beach too.
review: beautiful blue sky lot activity one day probably good enough complete activity love much fun family hoard visitor try various activity

Content: You can enjoy the day under the trees on a sunbed and the breeze off the ocean is very pleasant, waiters will serve on you so no need to move!
review: enjoy day tree sunbed breeze ocean pleasant waiter will serve need move

Content: Beautiful beach, but very rough waters. It is very difficult to swim there. Lots of hotels on the beach. It was not very busy for a beautiful beach. It's quite a walk unless you're staying at a nearby hotel.
review: beautiful rough water difficult swim lot hotel busy beautiful quite walk unless youre stay nearby hotel

Content: Great sandy beach lots of fun walking in the sea a beach well worth visiting lots of place to sit and relax also to have fun amongst the waves
review: great sandy lot fun walk sea well worth visit lots place sit relax fun amongst wave

Content: Every thing about this hotel was great AAA rating will stay again in the near future Palace Club  is worth staying in.
review: every thing hotel great aaa rating will stay near future palace club worth stay

Content: Based on the tides this is 3 beaches combined into 1.  Low tide and the beach traces back. Medium and water upto your knees and high tide then you ready to surf. Kids and adults galore love it.
review: base tide 3 beach combine 1 low tide trace back medium water upto knee high tide ready surf kid adult galore love

Content: What a stunning beach!, beautiful white soft sand, clear blue waters that are warm and inviting.  It's like a little lagoon with no waves and stays shallow for a long way out giving you the confidence that it's more than safe to relax in the waters.  Little fish can be seen darting about. If you're after banana boats and jet skis whizzing up and down all day long then this isn't the beach for you. Beach cleaners from the surrounding hotels are constantly raking up washed up seaweed and keeping this beach pristine. The only annoyance is the 'lookie, lookie' sales men and women regularly stopping to sell you their wares, but they are friendly and polite and do move on.  I have had worse experiences with this in the world!
review: stun beautiful white soft sand clear blue water warm invite little lagoon wave stay shallow long way give confidence safe relax water little fish see dart youre banana boat jet skis whiz day long isnt cleaner surround hotel constantly rake wash seaweed keep pristine annoyance lookie lookie sale men woman regularly stop sell ware friendly polite move worse experience world

Content: The beach is clean and well maintained, but there are a number of locals in blue shirts with numbers on their backs who walk around trying to sell you everything from a ride on a boat to cheaply made dresses. I understand that is how they make a living, but I just want to enjoy the beach, not have to tell someone every 5 mins that I do not want a ride a banana float.
review: clean well maintain number local blue shirt number back walk around try sell everything ride boat cheaply make dress understand make living want enjoy tell someone every 5 min want ride banana float

Content: We loved the beach but beware of big waves and currents. The bech walk is long and really nice to walk on.

Content: Cannot fault anything... from staff, rooms, service and location.Paradise! Very relaxing soaking in the sun, beautiful pools, great food.
review: fault anything staff room service locationparadise relax soak sun beautiful pool great food

Content: small, windy and almost always low tidelots of boats arriving and a smell of gasoline when they arrive
review: small windy almost always low tidelots boat arrive smell gasoline arrive

Content: Nothing spectacular, but I guess some people like it quieter than a crowded beach like Kuta. The best spots are owned by hotels/resorts and the section with public access is nothing to shout about. It lacks shades from the scorching hot sun other than the chargeable loungers. It's not a place that I would regret not visiting.Generally a quiet and clean beach, suitable for early mornings or around sunsets.
review: nothing spectacular guess people quieter crowd kuta best spot own hotelsresorts section public access nothing shout lack shade scorch hot sun chargeable lounger place regret visitinggenerally quiet clean suitable early morning around sunset

Content: pristine beaches,water was very warm and pleasant to spend the day in just catching the waves,they rank second to the maldives in my list
review: pristine beacheswater warm pleasant spend day catch wavesthey rank second maldives list

Content: Nusa Dua beach is one of the most beautiful beach in Bali.. We visited here during the new years holiday and it was very good, beautiful sand, clean and safe for children. The wave is blocked few metres away from the edge, so the children are safe to play.Will visit back..!
review: nusa dua one beautiful bali visit new year holiday good beautiful sand clean safe child wave block metre away edge child safe playwill visit back

Content: I like the beach, very clean and secluded. Few more food and beverages options would be helpful, and water sports can make it  more attractive
review: clean seclude food beverage option helpful water sport make attractive

Content: The beach is beautiful to look at and walk on.  The week we spent there the water was calm everyday and the water was clear and very warm.  Only a few locals out selling their wares and they generally moved on once you said no thank you.
review: beautiful look walk week spent water calm everyday water clear warm local sell ware generally move say thank

Content: Hotels in nusa  dua has all the security and serenity of a gated community ( which it really is not) beach beautiful in the usual Balinese style but very clean and hassle free unlike the beaches in Kuta or Jimbaren.
review: hotel nusa dua security serenity gate community really beautiful usual balinese style clean hassle free unlike beach kuta jimbaren

Content: It was nice to place to relax beach! It was great to be for swiming. It was very clean and quite water to dove in! Will recommend it
review: nice place relax great swiming clean quite water dove will recommend

Content: Beautiful calm waters, lovely aqua colours and not too deep so great for taking a dip without massive waves.  Most of the Nusa Dua beach area is private beaches belonging to big hotel chains, so great if you are staying in one of them, if not, then you are restricted to a few crappy sections of the beach without sunloungers.  Very relaxing beach environment with no street vendors to harass you.  be warned though, there are only hotel bars and restaurants along the beach with prices that are higher than Australian restaurants (and not always as good a quality).
review: beautiful calm water lovely aqua colour deep great take dip without massive wave nusa dua area private beach belong big hotel chain great stay one restrict crappy section without sunloungers relax environment street vendor harass warn though hotel bar restaurant along price high australian restaurant always good quality

Content: A clean beach with small waves. Not the prettiest beach I’ve seen. Fairly empty . The sand is not as white and fine as in some other countries! Water sports available.

Content: Not enough umbrellas unless  you got there early. Deceptively strong undercurrent. Quite big waves. Lack of lifeguards

Content: During my trip to Bali, i visited Nusa Dua beach. Very beautiful beach. I tried lot of water sports like Paracyling, Scuba Dive etc for the first time in my life. Must see in Bali

Content: Nothing much offered here. Signed up for water sports package which cost about US$28 consisting of parasailing, jetski and banana boat. They rushed you to do the activities and then done. Intended to relax but was disappointed at the mad rush through the activities. Not worth it. Dont bother unless you have never seen a beach.

Not worth the risk. The area has a reputation for claiming the lives of unsuspecting tourist. If you have children...much better to stay poolside if you're staying at a hotel.

Content: At high tide the beach was great, at low tide not so great.  Warm water in March which was great.Being from Queensland, we have the best beaches in the world!!!

Content: Nusa Dua beach is in the gated resort complex, so there are no hawkers, and very few locals. This is a great place to watch the sunrise, and at that time you will also see a few locals catching crabs and gathering seaweed during low tide. There are not really any waves, so do not expect to do any surfing, and I believe most of the beach is private, so unless you are staying at one of the nearby resorts, you may not be able to use the beach. There are many restaurants at the many resorts that line the beach, but they are pricey.
review: nusa dua gate resort complex hawker locals great place watch sunrise time will see local catch crab gather seaweed low tide really wave expect surf believe private unless stay one nearby resort may able use many restaurant many resort line pricey

Content: Sofitel Nusa Dua Bali hotel voucher for sale. A 2 nights stay at Luxury Room with Pool access. Inclusive of full board meal, access to Club Millesime, Balinese Massage, Bicycle tour, Archery activity.It is said that the voucher worth 25,000,000 IDR. I would like to sell it for 10,000,000 IDR. Content: The beach looked great but I couldn't see any life savers on duty. Especially when the sand in the beach in the water is like quicksand and if your not a strong swimmer you would be in trouble. There should be signs with warnings and lifeguards on patrol 24/7. It's an accident waiting to happen. I suggest you swim in the resort pool its much safer.
review: look great couldnt see life saver duty especially sand water quicksand strong swimmer trouble sign warning lifeguard patrol 247 accident wait happen suggest swim resort pool much safer

Content: clean in the summer. not crowded. good for swimming and kids. long. very nice sand. very good for walking. romantic.

Content: Beautiful and private beach. Sand was not white but the waters were clear and blue.There weren't many people milling around and beach chairs widely spaced out.

Content: A long stretch of sand with plenty to see so. Large stretches are given over to chain hotels and, whilst lawns are manicured, adjacent restaurants are steep. It's a beautiful place to visit (we did jetskis etc) but do your research first on what you are looking for.

review: lovely sandy pebble lovely warm sea plenty sunbeds attentive staff melia hotel seller tot sarong jewellery

Content: Go to Bali for the culture, not the beach.  There are many more beautiful beaches in South East Asia.  Nusa Dua beach was nice though.

Content: I loved the fact that we had the beach to own own. We stayed at Courtyard by Marriott and they had their own private beach.There are sun beds to relax and towels. Weather was perfect. Best time to go there is around the morning time until around 1-2pm. After that you get low tides and it’s not that great.I really enjoyed my time swimming about and enjoyed the swimming.You do get people trying to sell you stuff or ask if you are interested in water sports. It can get annoying at some point when you are trying to relax but I guess they need to make their money as well.
review: love fact stay courtyard marriott private beachthere sun bed relax towel weather perfect best time go around morning time around 12pm low tide greati really enjoyed time swim enjoy swimmingyou people try sell stuff ask interested water sport annoy point try relax guess need make money well

Content: We found the Nusa Dua region when going to the Devdan Show and decided that we must come back to the quaint little town. Te town in itself is very scenic and very clean, almost too picture-perfect. The Nusa Dua beach is by far my favourite beach in Bali as it is very very very quiet and one can access a small temple which is hidden amidst the beach. The view from the small temple is spectacular. The beach is also very quiet unlike the other beaches in Bali (i.e. Kuta and Jimbaran) so it is a nice change  and its a great place to lazily lounge around and do nothing! For lunch, there is a small mall not far off the beach and there are a few local street food stalls near the beach.

Content: This is a calm type of beach. The sand is good and the water is kind of clear but not for too much snorkeling.
review: calm type sand good water kind clear much snorkeling

Content: Lil bit expensive. Most of the outlet own by a private hotels, so you have to pay for rides to get in. Our guide had connections with the local outlet and I could go in for sneak preview, and a discount was offered. But we were not in for water sports and so we decided not to go in.That was good decision as I observed the way parasailing is done. We had done parasailing in Tarkali in India and at Pattaya, Thailand from moving boat and platform in sea. But at Nusa Dua, they hook you up while you are standing on beach sand and ask you run. The boat pickups speed and you are dragged a bit. The worst part is landing. When you are about to touch the ground 2-3 guys jump on you to stop and hold while you are getting dragged. Lot of tourists get injured, bruising on hand and on legs are common. It's very dangerous.Go on your own risk.
review: lil bit expensive outlet private hotel pay ride guide connection local outlet go sneak preview discount offer water sport decide go inthat good decision observe way parasailing do do parasailing tarkali india pattaya thailand move boat platform sea nusa dua hook stand sand ask run boat pickup speed dragged bit bad part land touch ground 23 guy jump stop hold get drag lot tourist injure bruise hand leg common dangerousgo risk

If you are expedting crystal blue waters.. this is not the place but still one of the best beach in Bali is what i would say!

Coming from Australia I think we take clean beach for granted .

However, when we were there there were warnings up regarding jellyfish and other sea creatures due to the winds so we decided to have a quick dip in the warm water and then move to the pools in our resort. But definitely a peaceful place to sit down and read a good book!

Content: It really was very lovely and clean and well kept.  Sadly I have been spoilt in the Maldives and will not swim in anything not completely clear, turquiose and sparkly!

Content: Great to get out and do some water sports the beaches are great to walk along has some f the best hotels with friendly staff
review: great water sport beach great walk along f best hotel friendly staff

Content: I don't usually spend time on beaches. I did here, so relaxing. The sea is an amazing blue. We also walked along the path to the Temple and saw the blow hole. It was a wonderful experience
review: dont usually spend time beach relax sea amaze blue walk along path temple saw blow hole wonderful experience

Content: Really clear water, much cleaner than Kuta but kind of boring if you're not doing water sports. Also most of the beach is reserved for hotel guests and a small section is public, where vendors start charging Rp. 250,000.00 for a deck chair and you can maybe bargain down to 100,000.00 so felt abit alienated. Better in the morning, low tide in July so the water started moving back slowly as the afternoon went on, pretty cool to see though! There were some food stalls there with seating space, nothing impressive, a 500ml water cost Rp.10,000.00 hotel prices so pack a nice picnic basket.
review: really clear water much clean kuta kind boring youre water sport reserve hotel guest small section public vendor start charge rp 25000000 deck chair maybe bargain 10000000 felt abit alienate well morning low tide july water start move back slowly afternoon go pretty cool see though food stall seat space nothing impressive 500ml water cost rp1000000 hotel price pack nice picnic basket

Content: We did sea walk and parasailing at this beach. It was great fun. Didn’t really spend time on the beach though but I think this is the only beach worth going to. Others are pretty mediocre.
review: sea walk parasailing great fun didnt really spend time though think worth go others pretty mediocre

Content: Beautiful beach with white sands...lots of high end hotels in the area...things are expensive  in that area....we went to do the water sports in that area.
review: beautiful white sandslots high end hotel areathings expensive areawe go water sport area

Content: Beach had a fair amount of plastic garbage on the high water mark. The rest of the beach was clean and well maintained.
review: fair amount plastic garbage high water mark rest clean well maintain

Content: Very clean & Clear water beach with not so huge tide..Very well maintained. Some companies like Thirtha Harum operate water sports.
review: clean clear water huge tidevery well maintain company thirtha harum operate water sport

Content: The Nusa Dua Beach is very clam and soothing. Not many people around so one has all the time and space to oneself. Ideal time to go to the beach is around 4 pm.
review: nusa dua clam soothe many people around one time space oneself ideal time go around 4 pm

Content: Problems with tides bringing in seaweed and rubbish. Not for swimming as also has problems with sea urchins.
review: problem tide bring seaweed rubbish swimming problem sea urchin

Content: Great place to spend a few hours or a whole day. Water very clean and safe and sand clean and white.
review: great place spend hour whole day water clean safe sand clean white

Content: Best beach in Bali if you want really good sand and sun. Advisable to go by cab as we were staying in seminyak (45min drive). Had an amazing day at beach. Be careful of prices as this is a premium beach. Would advise shoppers to do shopping in Kuta and Seminyak (we brought stuff which was at 50% cost in other places)...
review: best bali want really good sand sun advisable go cab stay seminyak 45min drive amazing day careful price premium advise shopper shop kuta seminyak bring stuff 50 cost place

Content: This is a beautiful beach, with cool lava formations and blue water. There’s no trash and lots of sandy beach. Some parts get less pretty in low tide and watch out of jellyfish. I got stung once- it was shocking but manageable and healed by the next day.
review: beautiful cool lava formation blue water there trash lot sandy part less pretty low tide watch jellyfish get stung shock manageable heal next day

Content: The Beach looks amazing but the times we have been the currents are very strong so swimming in the sea is not advisable.  The sand near the sea has lots of pebbles rocks and stones so suitable footwear would be recommended.  These comments might be just because of the time of year we visited Bali and some beaches will be safer and better than others.
review: look amazing time current strong swim sea advisable sand near sea lot pebbles rock stone suitable footwear recommend comment might time year visit bali beach will safer good others

Content: Well kept, lovely long and wide beach.. staff at Grand Bali Hyat keep their area very well maintained and clean, much appreciated
review: well keep lovely long wide staff grand bali hyat keep area well maintain clean much appreciate

Content: A beautiful and safe beach that is constantly kept clean through out the day with access to numerous restaurants and activities.
review: beautiful safe constantly kept clean day access numerous restaurant activity

Content: The beach outside the resort (we stayed at The Westin) was stunning and very well groomed.  There is a reasonable amount of seaweed and rubbish (namely plastic bags) that float in the water from beaches elsewhere.The sand is beautiful, water temperature amazing in April, however we did get a couple of little stings (didn't last for long) but it was enough to send us back to the pool.We walked around the bay further (south side) which is where the locals hang out and the beach is absolutely littered with plastic bottles and bags.  Not so nice but important to see how the locals live versus the tourists.
review: outside resort stay westin stun well groom reasonable amount seaweed rubbish namely plastic bag float water beach elsewherethe sand beautiful water temperature amaze april couple little sting didnt last long enough send u back poolwe walk around bay south side local hang absolutely litter plastic bottle bag nice important see local live versus tourist

Content: By far the best beach in Bali we have seen. If you are here it's worth checking out and once you do you won't leave you will keep coming back. Even if you are staying in another hotel make sure to come here. Blue water white sand everything you need. Great food and drinks you can pay to sit at one of the hotels umbrellas if you order food and drinks and spend the day there. We checked out a few beaches and this was by far the best. Also if you fancy a surf lesson you can do it here.
review: far best bali see worth check wont leave will keep come back even stay another hotel make sure come blue water white sand everything need great food drink pay sit one hotel umbrellas order food drink spend day check beach far best fancy surf lesson

Content: We stayed for a couple of days in Nusa Dua and checked out the beach. It wasn't amazing, as we expected. It was a golden sand beach - long stretch and wasn't much dramatic. It was still nice to hang out in, to swim and spend time with family, but I wouldnt go to Nusa Dua all the way to check out this beach.
review: stayed couple day nusa dua checked wasnt amaze expect golden sand long stretch wasnt much dramatic still nice hang swim spend time family wouldnt go nusa dua way check

Content: The personal reviews depend on where you come from and where you live there: units, houses and country I come from beautiful Nowra nsw Australia 20 Mts from beautiful beaches with real white sands I accidentally came to Bali in 2017 and with regrets I joined a Resort Bali membership so here I am again 2018 in Nusa Dua for a couple of weeks"free accommodation" it happens after coming back from five weeks in Acapulco and Cancun Mexico no comparison what so ever with little boring Bali that everything have to be imported from Australia and Thailand food and craft I had been seven times in BBK and Phuket Island I am not the tourist that come out to the hotel stay in swimming pool all day have some drinks and then catch the airplane go back to there country I do not like how hotel and restaurants treat tourists when they re sell imported food apply services and taxes etc. Retreats
review: personal review depend come live unit house country come beautiful nowra nsw australia 20 mt beautiful beach real white sand accidentally come bali 2017 regret join resort bali membership 2018 nusa dua couple weeksfree accommodation happen come back five week acapulco cancun mexico comparison little boring bali everything import australia thailand food craft seven time bbk phuket island tourist come hotel stay swim pool day drink catch airplane go back country hotel restaurant treat tourist re sell import food apply service tax etc retreat

Content: Lovely Coleman  sloping beach that takes you into warm crystal clear waters, the beach itself is sparsely populated.
review: lovely coleman slop take warm crystal clear water sparsely populate

Content: Hello, We stayed at the Grand Aston and have also stayed at the Grand Mirage both have very good beach fronts but in front of the Aston was allot better in our opinion, they are only separated by a stones throw but the resorts in question may spend a bit more time cleaning their own backyard, don't know but we liked the beach in front of the Aston and the further you went south, i think it was south seemed to get better.At low tide you can walk out to where the reef starts in front of the Aston, but don't get caught the tide comes in pretty fast.Worth the walk out there.As far Nusa Dua beach itself very nice but seems to get busy, unless you are staying at a resort directly on that beach look at going early otherwise battle with joe public.
review: hello stay grand aston stay grand mirage good front front aston allot good opinion separate stone throw resort question may spend bit time clean backyard dont know like front aston go south think south seem betterat low tide walk reef start front aston dont catch tide come pretty fastworth walk thereas far nusa dua nice seem busy unless stay resort directly look go early battle joe public

Content: Have been to Nusa Dua Beach numerous times over the years and there are exceptional areas as well as just basic areas.One of the better ones is the beach near the Conrad Hotel.Great waters, strong waters which the kids absolutely loved!We also took the opportunity to ride a jetski which the kids thoroughly enjoyed. The ‘beach access’ for the Grand Whiz hotel was mostly rocky.
review: nusa dua numerous time year exceptional area well basic areasone good one near conrad hotelgreat water strong water kid absolutely lovedwe take opportunity ride jetski kid thoroughly enjoy access grand whiz hotel mostly rocky

Content: This is one of the best beaches in Bali as some of the others can collect trash after the rains. Clean beach and good for swimming during high tide, not worth it in low tide.
review: one best beach bali others collect trash rain clean good swimming high tide worth low tide

Content: One of the good beaches with a row of 5 star luxury hotels so that each hotel maintains the beach as a whole.standing on the beach , you also get a good view of the bali and sea .
review: one good beach row 5 star luxury hotel hotel maintain wholestanding good view bali sea

Content: Nusa dua public beach is a beautiful quiet beach in Bali. The sea is beautiful. It's not to far from Seminyak and Kuta area. Here less beach sellers than Kuta.
review: nusa dua public beautiful quiet bali sea beautiful far seminyak kuta area less seller kuta

Content: This beach was very windy when I was there. I enjoyed just sitting there and strolled along the beach with many scenic corners for photo shooting. Worth visiting the place again
review: windy enjoy sit stroll along many scenic corner photo shoot worth visit place

Content: We loved Nusa Dua beach it was so clean and beautiful not many people selling things which was nice and overall loved it kids could swim with the net being there felt safer
review: love nusa dua clean beautiful many people sell thing nice overall loved kid swim net felt safer

Content: We went there during the New Year holiday and it was really full of people. Most of them are domestic tourist, and what they did was similar with what people did in Kuta few years ago: picnics, bring the whole family, and spend some times on the beach. Probably empty on off-peak season. The sand was albeit coarse.
review: go new year holiday really full people domestic tourist similar people kuta year ago picnic bring whole family spend time probably empty offpeak season sand albeit coarse

Content: The beach is very safe, clean, & fine sand. It is very shallow to swim in, at low tide it is impossible to swim in as it is so shallow. Boats go from the beach to the reef for snorkling.
review: safe clean fine sand shallow swim low tide impossible swim shallow boat go reef snorkling

Content: Quiet and peaceful beach with a great view.  There are plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas along the sand for parents to lounge while the kids play in the water. While lying there, you can see jet skis, banana boats and other water activities race on the open waters and still enjoy a nice drink.  The kids had a blast in the water because the waves were minimal and the water was warm.
review: quiet peaceful great view plenty chair umbrellas along sand parent lounge kid play water lie see jet ski banana boat water activity race open water still enjoy nice drink kid blast water wave minimal water warm

Content: A most tranquil and beautiful beach in Bali. Golden sands, Palm trees and crystal clear waters make for a most enjoyable and tranquil visit.
review: tranquil beautiful bali golden sand palm tree crystal clear water make enjoyable tranquil visit

Content: The beach is pristeen and safe although too shallow to swim. At low tide you get to walk out to the reef that completely protects the bay. There are a few vendors in the beach but they are friendly and not overly pushy.
review: pristeen safe although shallow swim low tide walk reef completely protect bay vendor friendly overly pushy

Content: As travellers that have been to Seminyak, Canggu, Ubug, Gili's and Lombok before we were really disappointed by Nusa Dua (very artificial, overpriced, not authentic, no good restaurants!). We felt like we ended up in Disney Land. Everything is full of Chinese tourists, we even got asked by them if they can take pictures of us (we are Europeans). Place of mass tourism, crowded beaches, you'll get the Nusa Dua bonus on everything you buy (scooters, petrol, hotels, food). If all this doesn't matter to you and you want to ride a jetski, go parasailing or whatever do watersport in a place which does not represent Bali at all, then spend 100$ more and go to a hotel in the gated area!
review: traveller seminyak canggu ubug gilis lombok really disappointed nusa dua artificial overprice authentic good restaurant felt end disney land everything full chinese tourist even get asked take picture u europeans place mass tourism crowd beach youll nusa dua bonus everything buy scooter petrol hotel food doesnt matter want ride jetski go parasailing whatever watersport place represent bali spend 100 go hotel gate area

Content: A total contrast to beaches on the West Coast of Bali.  Beach is long and clean with relatively few hawkers. Sand is obviously trucked in by the high end resorts - you can feel the difference when you are out the front of the better resorts.
review: total contrast beach west coast bali long clean relatively hawker sand obviously truck high end resort feel difference front well resort

Content: Great clean water, great sunbeds and service from the resorts. Staff always ready to help and take your order
review: great clean water great sunbeds service resort staff always ready help take order

Content: Hi a Guys, were staying at the Bali Hyatt, which is on the beach, nice beach gutter to swim in, the sandbar / reef effect puts the surf about 60 mts out, so if swimming isn't your strong point or the kids want to paddle this may be for you. There's a surf school outside the Hyatt grounds, so get the kids lessons, you won't regret it,  So do yourself a favour, get out of the banana lounge walk to Nusa Dua beach, put on the budgie smugglers and have a dip.  Regards Scott Land of Oz 😁😎
review: hi guy stay bali hyatt nice gutter swim sandbar reef effect put surf 60 mt swim isnt strong point kid want paddle may theres surf school outside hyatt ground kid lesson wont regret favour banana lounge walk nusa dua put budgie smuggler dip regard scott land oz

Content: Nusa Dua's beachs are the best beaches in bali if you are looking to take a nice safe swim in crystal clear waters.  Unlike the beaches in Seminyak and Kuta there are no waves so it is safe for kids and people who are not great swimmers to wade in the waters and have fun.  Make sure you check it out for that tropical island feel.
review: nusa duas beach best beach bali look take nice safe swim crystal clear water unlike beach seminyak kuta wave safe kid people great swimmer wade water fun make sure check tropical island feel

Content: I’m reporting on the strip of beach from the Nusa Dua Hotel up to the Melia near the Bali Collection. No waves at all for this stretch but they can be seen some distance out as they hit the reef, so the sea is fairly gentle with a strong ‘current’ right to left as you look at it. There are buoys fairly close to shore and guests are asked to swim within those boundaries and warned of sea urchins at low tide. The sand is constantly raked to dispose of the seaweed as it covers the sea bed up to the reef and beach cleaners are in evidence. There are ‘licenced’ vendors in blue polo shirts all numbered, selling: watches/ water sports/ handbags/ sarongs etc, but well behaved and leave you alone. There is a pathway all the way along with good beachside restaurants owned by the hotels and they are friendly and seem to be good quality. There is a massive building project on the go which is a shame but I dare say when finished it will be great, that is past the Melia and the little ‘island’.Paddle boarding and kayaking is ideal and there is the obligatory jet ski which zoom past but they take the paying guests further down past the Nusa Dua beach hotel to play.
review: im reporting strip nusa dua hotel melia near bali collection wave stretch see distance hit reef sea fairly gentle strong current right leave look buoy fairly close shore guest ask swim within boundary warn sea urchin low tide sand constantly rake dispose seaweed cover sea bed reef cleaner evidence licence vendor blue polo shirt number sell watch water sport handbags sarong etc well behave leave alone pathway way along good beachside restaurant own hotel friendly seem good quality massive building project go shame dare say finish will great past melia little islandpaddle board kayak ideal obligatory jet ski zoom past take pay guest past nusa dua hotel play

Content: We have visited once before and this time round we fully enjoyed the beach. Beautiful soft sands, shallow waters, although the waves do crash down further out. It’s amazing to watch!
review: visited time round fully enjoy beautiful soft sand shallow water although wave crash amazing watch

Content: Before our recent visit to Bali we read a lot about dirty beaches. Well the beaches from Nusa Dua are simply breathtaking and beautiful. We walked along a few hotels and all beaches were clean. No worries and have a great stay.
review: recent visit bali read lot dirty beach well beach nusa dua simply breathtaking beautiful walk along hotel beach clean worry great stay

Content: We spent here 3 hours with our driver. There are 2 beaches. Beaches is very nice with clean and clear water. On the beach were just a few people, it was great. No entrance fee.
review: spent 3 hour driver 2 beach beach nice clean clear water people great entrance fee

Content: It was a superb experience with Mr.Gel gel. He took all the efforts from pick up , all the sports and dropping. What ever he advises is apt. He told us to pay for only 4 sports and if we have still energy left then we can plan as he advised we were completely drained after 4 sports. My 4 year son had a great time and it is Very safe. He takes all precautions to ensure everything is alright. Jet water pack is the best it is not so easy his instructors were very good. Very patient they were and they were very happy when I finally succeeded...perfect teachers
review: superb experience mrgel gel take effort pick sport drop advises apt tell u pay 4 sport still energy leave plan advise completely drained 4 sport 4 year son great time safe take precaution ensure everything alright jet water pack best easy instructor good patient happy finally succeededperfect teacher

Content: Was not impressed with the beach....alot of coral and rocks...stayed at club med and only explored that stretch of beach....
review: impressed beachalot coral rocksstayed club med explore stretch

Content: Visited the Melia Bali in April as a solo traveller. The hotel, staff, manicured grounds, ambience and food in all the restaurants was indeed very good  and in some cases exceptional. A large hotel... perhaps a little dated but this does not detract from the experience. Very clean and welcoming.The beach is lovely albeit not on the scale of the beaches to recent visits to Mauritius and Sri Lanka. Tended to be hounded by beach vendors.I had a swim up premium lagoon room which on hindsight would not book again as could not use most of the time in April as the evening rains waterlogged the sun beds so could not use!The restaurants are superb and I can not fault any of them frombreakfast to a la carte evening meals. The standard of cuisine is indeed of the highest quality.Bali is a beautiful island and her islanders are indeed proud to show her off... however I found it very touristy and a little congested in places in particular Denpasar where traffic jams are commonplace.Enjoyed my visit but will not be rushing back anytime soon.
review: visit melia bali april solo traveller hotel staff manicure ground ambience food restaurant indeed good case exceptional large hotel perhaps little dated detract experience clean welcomingthe lovely albeit scale beach recent visit mauritius sri lanka tend hound vendorsi swim premium lagoon room hindsight book use time april evening rain waterlogged sun bed usethe restaurant superb fault frombreakfast la carte even meal standard cuisine indeed high qualitybali beautiful island islander indeed proud show find touristy little congested place particular denpasar traffic jam commonplaceenjoyed visit will rush back anytime soon

Content: The beach is beautiful, the water warm and clear, good for snorkelling. The beach comers are constantly cleaning, didn’t seem to be millions of fag butts like I’ve seen on so many others.
review: beautiful water warm clear good snorkelling comer constantly clean didnt seem million fag butts ive see many others

Content: The beach at Ayodya Resort is really really nice and especially the way the Ayodya Resort spills onto it is magnificent. Great design with the infinity pool + beach bar + colourful setting flowing onto the sands.
review: ayodya resort really really nice especially way ayodya resort spill onto magnificent great design infinity pool bar colourful set flow onto sand

Content: Our first couple of days here this beach was heavenly. Clean, crystal water and peaceful. However a couple of days in I was shocked and the piles and piles of rubbish on the beach and floating in the water. So disappointing.
review: first couple day heavenly clean crystal water peaceful couple day shock pile pile rubbish float water disappointing

Content: Such a great beach! Beautiful view of volcano, spectacular sunsets and great restaurant all around where you can chill out and still enjoy the views.
review: great beautiful view volcano spectacular sunset great restaurant around chill still enjoy view

Content: Area, where are hotels, is very clean and safe. Also is near here Bali Collection, where can man eat and shop everything.Beach is big, nice but little dirty
review: area hotel clean safe near bali collection man eat shop everythingbeach big nice little dirty

Content: Clean white sand and beautiful blue water.Balmy breezes and warm sunshine! Good food at both the Sofitel Resort and Nusa Dua Beach Resort
review: clean white sand beautiful blue waterbalmy breeze warm sunshine good food sofitel resort nusa dua resort

Content: try to see the sunset with a cocktail in your hand and profite about the amazing placeperfect for a couple to spend romantic time and try the water oohhhhhhh amazing
review: try see sunset cocktail hand profite amazing placeperfect couple spend romantic time try water oohhhhhhh amaze

Content: One of the best beaches you can go..be it night or day nusa dua beach gives you calm..water is good and clean..best part when u sitting on a private beach there is no dearth of beer around you.
review: one best beach gobe night day nusa dua give calmwater good cleanbest part u sit private dearth beer around

Content: Nothing special but cleaner than Kuta and SeminyakNo really choice for a drink at a local bar - dominated by hotels and expensive bar & food prices
review: nothing special cleaner kuta seminyakno really choice drink local bar dominate hotel expensive bar food price

Content: Beautiful and clean full of resorts. We weren't allowed to be under the trees. Bring your own shade or spend time in the public part and hire a beach chair.  Take a trip down to waterblow
review: beautiful clean full resort werent allow tree bring shade spend time public part hire chair take trip waterblow

Content: Beautiful beach to stroll on especially in the morning or evening.  The beach goes for miles and with the pristine water to swim in is a must.
review: beautiful stroll especially morning evening go mile pristine water swim must

Content: Lovely place but not the real Bali.  The whole time we were there we were desperate to get out and see the real Bali.  It was our honeymoon so we did go for extra special but that came with security and a peninsular which was manicured within an inch of its life. In hindsight it would never have been something for us as we prefer the real deal.
review: lovely place real bali whole time desperate see real bali honeymoon go extra special come security peninsular manicure within inch life hindsight never something u prefer real deal

Content: the beach was clean and quite you can relax and enjoy the beach without any crowd, if you with a kids i think it was a perfect beach to play
review: clean quite relax enjoy without crowd kid think perfect play

Content: clean and uncrowded, a delightful retreat from the dogs and seediness that is present on Kuta beach.  Much slower pace and not so many vendors selling useless things to tourists.
review: clean uncrowded delightful retreat dog seediness present kuta much slow pace many vendor sell useless thing tourist

Content: Best to swim Eastern side of beach near Hyatt. 2 beaches to chose from - separated by a headland with spectacular blow hole. Well worth a visit.
review: best swim eastern side near hyatt 2 beach chose separate headland spectacular blow hole well worth visit

Content: Its a perfect place to sit back, relax and unwind. The beach is nice and clean and the water is warm with gentle currents. Perfect for taking a dip. You can also try beach kayaking which is fun. If you are tired, just rent out a beach mat and relax under the sky. Eateries around the place can be quite expensive so carry refreshments and your Bintang from stores outside the beach. Also, try to visit the Nusa Dua Garden of Hope which is just next to the beach.
review: perfect place sit back relax unwind nice clean water warm gentle current perfect take dip try kayak fun tire rent mat relax sky eatery around place quite expensive carry refreshment bintang store outside try visit nusa dua garden hope next

Content: Having fun under the sun was the best thing to do in Bali with their fun water activities especially the banana boat riding and parasailing. It is a must try/things to do in Bali.
review: fun sun best thing bali fun water activity especially banana boat rid parasailing must trythings bali

Content: Perfect for family with kids. The current is mild and water is pleasant so kids happily go into the ocean. Sunrise is gorgeous. And the beach is lit up for the evening. Spectacular. Great for watersports for beginners: paddle board, windsurf, etc. Close to great snorkling and diving sites. Love it!
review: perfect family kid current mild water pleasant kid happily go ocean sunrise gorgeous lit evening spectacular great watersports beginner paddle board windsurf etc close great snorkling dive site love

Content: Excellent place to walk and get exercise in the morning.  It's quiet, not crowded.  You can also see the sunrise if it's not cloudy.
review: excellent place walk exercise morning quiet crowd see sunrise cloudy

Content: Not cold water. Sea is clean and beach crew clean the everywhere. No stones, no trash and so peacefull air. Sea has wave everytime but it's so funny.
review: cold water sea clean crew clean everywhere stone trash peacefull air sea wave everytime funny

Content: seaweed is everywhere.   I noticed in some of the bigger resorts - Ritz Carlton & The Mulia they had clean sands and water.   It was hard to navigate in the water to sandy bottoms with so much seaweed
review: seaweed everywhere notice big resort ritz carlton mulia clean sand water hard navigate water sandy bottom much seaweed

Content: The beach falls towards the south western end of the Bali. A stip of land with blue water beaches on two sides. For an ideal swim and a nap on the sands, suggest the right side beach when facing the statues. The left side beach is more an activity beach. Do NOT miss the water blow that lies behing the big statue. It would be one amazing experience
review: fall towards south western end bali stip land blue water beach two side ideal swim nap sand suggest right side face statue leave side activity miss water blow lie behing big statue one amazing experience

Content: Enjoyed just being in the water. The place is so clean, the walking pathways neat, local people are very friendly. It was just a pleasure. We went to the beach early at 6Am and just lost count of time:)
review: enjoyed water place clean walking pathway neat local people friendly pleasure go early 6am lose count time

Content: This is a beautiful stretch of beach. Beautiful white sand and cleaned everyday of debris that gets washed up during the night. A thing to keep in mind is to be aware of the tides. As at high tide it is great for swimming, but at low tide you have to walk a long way to get into water you able to swim in. Good for surfing as well.
review: beautiful stretch beautiful white sand clean everyday debris get wash night thing keep mind aware tide high tide great swim low tide walk long way water able swim good surfing well

Content: We walked around the beach and the shopping area. Just be careful that when you take a taxi back, the price is fixed and can be pricey. Hence you may want to get your pickup from wherever you come from.
review: walk around shop area careful take taxi back price fix pricey may want pickup wherever come

Content: Dnt miss if you love any form of water sports its simply great. there are various operators which offer different options. Drinking water and toilets are available near the beach. Beach is clean and great for hanging out.
review: dnt miss love form water sport simply great various operator offer different option drinking water toilet available near clean great hanging

Content: Lovely stretch of beach but the sand is very grainy and not easy to go for a long walk on.  There is a boardwalk but stops after the St Regis and then "private properties" afterwards.  Would love to see the boardwalk extended, then one could walk for km's.
review: lovely stretch sand grainy easy go long walk boardwalk stop st regis private property afterwards love see boardwalk extend one walk km

Content: Miles of white sandy beach alongside crystal clear blue water.  Direct access from our hotel, St. Regis, made this wonderful beach easily assessable.
review: mile white sandy alongside crystal clear blue water direct access hotel st regis make wonderful easily assessable

Content: A beautiful clear water beach with clean sandy beaches. The tide goes out about half a mile leaving pockets of warm clear water with starfish and other marine life in them. Absolutely beautiful.
review: beautiful clear water clean sandy beach tide go half mile leave pocket warm clear water starfish marine life absolutely beautiful

Content: at least from the hotel side (The Laguna, a Luxury Collection Resort & Spa, Nusa Dua, Bali, Nusa Dua) the sea is too far from the beach to swim
review: least hotel side laguna luxury collection resort spa nusa dua bali nusa dua sea far swim

Content: Certainly spending time of this beach in high tide is fun but there is an equal experience when it is low tide as you can walk out really quite far to where the waves break.
review: certainly spending time high tide fun equal experience low tide walk really quite far wave break

Content: Abnormally high tides in last few days. Beach path washed away just past Bali Collection. Hotels have sand bagged along beachside restaurants. Tides due to new moon and planet alignment are always higher this time of year, but this is not normal. Staff in hotels, beach front moved very fast and cleanup was efficient and thorough. Perfectly safe and still able to walk on most beaches.
review: abnormally high tide last day path wash away past bali collection hotel sand bag along beachside restaurant tide due new moon planet alignment always high time year normal staff hotel front move fast cleanup efficient thorough perfectly safe still able walk beach

Content: Nice clean beach. not crowdedBeach divided to area which own by the hotelRelaxing beach and nice to have a sunrise
review: nice clean crowdedbeach divide area hotelrelaxing nice sunrise

Content: The beach is clean with a white sand beach. Not very large wave, suitable for children to swim on the beach.
review: clean white sand large wave suitable child swim

Content: dived into the ocean after a long bike ride and it was crystal clear and just so refreshing. There looked like some good surf around the point as well
review: dive ocean long bike ride crystal clear refreshing look good surf around point well

Content: Beautiful clean beach, well maintained and not so crowded compared to Kuta beach. Recommended for family with kids
review: beautiful clean well maintain crowd compare kuta recommend family kid

Content: I stayed at laguna hotel the beach is nice and the atmostphere is perfect for relaxation . One note is that due to tides at sunrise you will find litteraly no sea by the beach become swamps all the way up to a barrier couple 100 m away . This effect is till 8 pm . Quite a disapointment if wanted to have a sun rise dip in the ocean
review: stay laguna hotel nice atmostphere perfect relaxation one note due tide sunrise will find litteraly sea become swamps way barrier couple 100 m away effect till 8 pm quite disapointment want sun rise dip ocean

Content: An absolutely beautiful place to visit. Nice beach along with good shops to shop from. Also, enjoyed a lot in the waters.
review: absolutely beautiful place visit nice along good shop shop enjoy lot water

Content: Areas clened by hotels such as the Conrad, Grand Hyatt and St Regis are great. There is still a lot of trash in the water though.

Content: I enjoyed the relaxing environment we had here i enjoyed  my pot of coffee just watching the beach and the sea go back and forth, and people watching what more is there todo.
review: enjoy relax environment enjoy pot coffee watch sea go back forth people watch todo

Content: Imagine nobody is here, a sandy beach to yourself, well not at all possible, too crowded, watch when you are going, you bound to step on someone half buried under the sand. A beach ideal for a quick dip and surfing, but unfortunately some hotels monopolise the better part
review: imagine nobody sandy well possible crowd watch go bound step someone half bury sand ideal quick dip surf unfortunately hotel monopolise good part

Content: Nice relaxing beach for a quite walk or lie down in one of the shades (rented). There are quite a few options of bar on the beach side. the view of the clear water is just amazing.

It is a beach for lying on and soaking up the sun.On the other hand, it is hardly worth getting into the sea.  The sea bed is only one to three feet below the surface all the way out to the reef about 250 metres out, and is covered in weed.  It does not invite any frolicking in the water.  You can, if you wish, find a weed-free 5 to 10 square metre patch and just lie in it.

Content: We stayed near here with the Courtyard Marriott for two nights, and walked to the beach to get some sun and rent paddle boards. Paddle board rentals were super cheap ($15/2 hrs), and it was fun, but the tide was going out, so the waves were quite small by mid afternoon. The trash in the water however...When you are on a surf or paddle board, the first thing you notice is all the plastic bottles, bags, and wrappers just floating on top of, or hovering just under, the surface. The water is beautiful, blue, and warm - it's just too bad that it's also the garbage disposal. I will say, however, that Bali is progressing in its awareness of trash and ocean conservation. It is much farther ahead than other islands in Indonesia. It is just going to take some time. I'm sure that a lot of the trash bags we picked up off the beach could have been perhaps 10 years old.The beach itself was quite clean, as most of the beach frontage is manicured by various hotel staff. We did have a very nice time there, drinks in hand, with nice soft beach chairs and umbrellas.

The public beach has life guards on duty so if you are in sight of them you will be looked after should you get into trouble. Massages are available as well as cheap cafes or more expensive hotels.

Content: We stayed at The Laguna Beach Resort which is on Nusa Dua Beach and were very pleased to discover the bay to be large with white clean sand and shallow crystal clear water.  The bay is protected by a natural reef and is tidal.  Early morning and late at night sees the tide withdraw uncovering tiny rock pools and where you can witness local fishermen walking on the seabed with head torches looking for shellfish etc.If you stand still in the water you can easily spot small shoals of stripey fish - some the size of your hand.  The water is extremely warm - enough to make you sit in the shallow areas without gasping as you would normally hold your breath from coolness upon entering!We were not bothered by anyone on the beach in attempts to sell anything to us, although we never "laid" on the beach loungers and only laid by the pool.  However, there is a purpose built footpath fringing the beach you can walk for some distance past all the hotels which leads to the Bali Collection (a shopping centre with restaurants)- part of this walk at night is lined with white lanterns swaying in the breeze which is very romantic.  Beyond the Bali Melia Hotel the beach becomes more public and the sand not as clean, littered with some seaweed and disgarded packaging - however, this appeared to be where the locals would sit in the tree shade and watch over their "little ones" playing in the shallow waters.
review: stay laguna resort nusa dua please discover bay large white clean sand shallow crystal clear water bay protect natural reef tidal early morning late night see tide withdraw uncover tiny rock pool witness local fisherman walk seabed head torch look shellfish etcif stand still water easily spot small shoal stripey fish size hand water extremely warm enough make sit shallow area without gasp normally hold breath coolness upon enteringwe bother anyone attempt sell anything u although never lay lounger lay pool purpose build footpath fringe walk distance past hotel lead bali collection shopping centre restaurant part walk night line white lantern sway breeze romantic beyond bali melia hotel become public sand clean litter seaweed disgarded packaging appear local sit tree shade watch little one play shallow water

Beautiful scenery!! It was great to go site seeing then we stopped into a hotel and had a beer. The perks of this is you can use their pool to cool down. We at the Pirates bay, you should check that out great experience :).The beach was so clean and water is clear.

Content: An excellent hotel, immaculately clean. Staff are fantastic, so friendly and helpful. There was a huge range of breakfast dishes to choose from and facilities to avail of. This hotel has something for everyone. A very peaceful and tranquil place to stay, would love to have been there longer.

Content: The beach was clean and had a lot of chairs/lounges to relax in.  It's a destination wedding venue and we saw brides and grooms everyday!  They had set up a flower arbor and it was kind of fun to watch the photography from a distance.  We also watched some locals fishing way out in the water wearing traditional fishing clothing and conical hats. Never saw them catching anything but it added to the scenery!  There is a nice walkway out to the water where you can watch the sunrise.  It is worth getting up one morning (at least) and walking out to photograph!  If you don't make it out of bed in time, I'm posting a photo for you to photoshop yourself into.  It's very lovely!

Content: This is an OK beach, not great for swimming, but if you like water activities, this is it.  This beach is much quieter, not too crowded.

Content: This beach is within the tourist precinct and therefore the majority of local vendors are restricted and actually carry a number, if your feel aggrieved. The beach has a large tide of several meters, and can be dangerous to those not familiar with surf at high tide. At half tide, the beach is safe, at low tide the cockle hunters go out to collect food.  Many 5 Star hotels are located on this beach.

Content: Don't miss visiting the beach if you are staying in Nusa Dua. It is clean and safe, has golden yellow sand, the ocean is shallow with no undercurrents, and there are plenty of small waves for surfing activity further out. There is some seaweed floating in the shallower waters.This is classified as a private beach so you don't have noisy watercraft, loud music, etc. The beach sellers don't hard sell.
review: dont miss visit stay nusa dua clean safe golden yellow sand ocean shallow undercurrent plenty small wave surf activity seaweed float shallow watersthis classify private dont noisy watercraft loud music etc seller dont hard sell

Content: Nusa Dua was my favorite of all beaches I visited during my time in Bali. It's super chill, clean, and lovely. I spent most of my time lying out on my chair under an umbrella, occasionally taking a dip, and it was a wonderful way to spend the day. Stayed here for a good 6 hours or so. The food being served was cheap and quite good, with the service also being good. All in all, I highly recommend spending a day here, and invest in an umbrella. It's worth it.

review: offer sea activity special visit turtle island glass bottom boat must enjoy beautiful coral way turtle many bird animal quench thirst end big big coconut water

Content: From the moment you arrive there, the process will take care of you. Considering the amount of fellow objects, they succeed amazingly well. Was lured into this hell to do a bit of snorkling. That bought me 2 slices of toast and a 3-minute boat trip to one of the dozens of floating platform from which thousands of tourists (most of whom obviously unable to swim) went all-in with their white bread. For anyone who's even snorkel before, would strongly suggest avoiding this nightmare. There may be a trashless beach somewhere in Bali where one can snorkel, I just failed to find it. The trip to Gili T. more than made it up for me.

Content: We visited the Nusa Dual Water blow on the Nusa Dual Peninsula Island on a perfect sunny day. The view is great however be visited at low tide. Only a short walk from Nusa Dua Beach and resorts. But be careful of the sharp rocks and don't get to close the edge.

Only negative is the constant hassling from the Hawkers.

Content: We were stayed at Kuta, we took kura kura bus from beach walk to DFS then transit to nusa dua, return tickets cost Irp 140000 pp, the beach is clean and not crowded, but we can't find any Balinese rent the lounge chair! So end up we join the agendaz beach club, NO entrance fee there, we just need to buy food or drink in the restaurant, we only paid for Irp 150000 pp for meal and drink, and the coffee was buy 1 get 1 free, then we can use the lounge chair and swimming pool. During afternoon low tide, most of the beach was just ankle deep. We enjoyed a lot, highly recommend!!!

Content: We stayed at Grand Hyatt hotel for 5 nights but every morning we were starting the day with long walks on the beach. The water was not very interesting for us (as we live in Cyprus where we have some very clean waters) and the tide made things worst at times.Nevertheless only seeing how long and clean the beach is, is an experience on its own. Sometimes jet lug is good as you wake up from 05.00 in the morning and you get to see the sunrise :)

Content: Bali. A land of gods & beauty. About 90% of the locals there are Hindu and the places there are surprisingly cleaner than some other south east Asia countries we have been to. Tourist attractions are in Ulu Watu, Jimbaran, Ubud and shopping belts are mostly centred around Seminyak & Kuta. We travelled in mid December and weather  is hot & humid without rain.With 3D4N, we covered almost all areas in south Bali except Legian.
review: bali land god beauty 90 local hindu place surprisingly cleaner south east asia country tourist attraction ulu watu jimbaran ubud shopping belt mostly centre around seminyak kuta travel mid december weather hot humid without rainwith 3d4n cover almost area south bali except legian

Content: Every day without fail my wife and I had a swim or a dip in the sea ( depending on the tide ) and afterwards a walk along the beach to dry off. It is cleared every day by the different hotels beach cleaners who keep it in tip top order. The only problem with this is that they also rake up the sea shells which we quite enjoy collecting. It is also a very interesting walk when the tide is out as you cane see lots of small fish in the shallows and if you are lucky a lot of starfish. Well worth the walk.
review: every day without fail wife swim dip sea depend tide afterwards walk along dry cleared every day different hotel cleaner keep tip top order problem rake sea shell quite enjoy collect interesting walk tide cane see lot small fish shallow lucky lot starfish well worth walk

Content: Perfect and staffs are very friendly and accommodating ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️the Hotel is very clean and I remember I booked me deluxe room but they put me in premiere room surprisingly and it was very overwhelming experience.I can’t wait to stay back .

It is a great place to swim or simply relax.There are good breaks for surfers but they are well off from the shore.

Content: I like the beach view and shaded chairs to relax. excellent views. shallow water. be prepared to be welcomed by lots of sea weed, its kinda irritating, you definitely dont like to swim there for long....I am not sure its like this every day or only the day we visited. open shower facility available...

Content: Supposedly the best beach in Bali. Yes it could have been that, with minimal surf but alas that is not the case. Mounds and mounds of rubbish dirty the beach both in the water and on the sand. Yes there are cleaners, quite a few of them actually who sweep the beach about mid morning, creating neat little piles of seaweed mixed with hard rubbish. but then what they end up doing is digging a shallow little hole right there on the shoreline and burying it!!! When the tide comes in, it all gets washed up again. We tried to swim and got sick with various skin conditions. We were very disappointed as the pictures are quite deceiving and do not give a good indication of the amounts of litter in the water. We are beach goers and took this vacation specifically to enjoy Mengiat Beach at Nusa Dua and not to just swim in a hotel pool. Very disappointing and we won't be going back.
review: supposedly best bali yes minimal surf ala case mound mound rubbish dirty water sand yes cleaner quite actually sweep mid morning create neat little pile seaweed mixed hard rubbish end dig shallow little hole right shoreline bury tide come get washed tried swim get sick various skin condition disappoint picture quite deceive give good indication amount litter water goer take vacation specifically enjoy mengiat nusa dua swim hotel pool disappointing wont go back

Content: We chose to stay at aresort next to the beach. The main problem was that for the first week thw tide seemed to out for most of the day so it was not suitable for swimming but in the second week the high tide was in the middle of the day and we had a great swim. The sand is white unlike the busy Kuta side of the island. It is not really busy and a really relaxing way to spend your holidays layong around and observing the view. Evidently there were dangers like stepping on sea urchins at low tide but signs alerted you to the dangers. The low tide provided you with the opportunity to walk out to the edge of the reef and look in the rock pools.

Content: We are a French family currently living in Singapore. It was the third time to Bali, so we wanted to stay at a clean and quiet beach, with no vendor bothering us, and where kids could swim in the sea. Purpose was just to relax.We found all this in Nusa Dua, although the area is secluded and the beach could be anywhere on the globe, as there is no specific Balinese taste when you are on this beach. But we knew it and just wanted to experience this for 5 days, not far from home.The sand was clean and blond as well, very nice. We could swim in the lagoon where the water was clear and pristine. There is a promenade along the beach, connecting all the hotels on this beach, most of them of high-end to luxury. The architectural design of most hotels fits well with the nature (wood/local style). The hotel buildings are also usually set back from the beach. So the natural seafront landscapte is relatively more preserved than on other sanur or kuta beaches.Of note, in South Bali, we find most beaches crowed, dirty and full of vendors that are very anoying sometimes. Some may say the vendors are part of the local experience. Agree but when it disturbs you, it is not pleasant at all. As for Nusa Dua beach, only 2 accredited vendors per hotel are allowed to sell stuff on the beach to guests and most of them are very polite and relatively discret.
review: french family currently live singapore third time bali want stay clean quiet vendor bother u kid swim sea purpose relaxwe find nusa dua although area seclude anywhere globe specific balinese taste know wanted experience 5 day far homethe sand clean blond well nice swim lagoon water clear pristine promenade along connect hotel highend luxury architectural design hotel fit well nature woodlocal style hotel building usually set back natural seafront landscapte relatively preserve sanur kuta beachesof note south bali find beach crow dirty full vendor anoying sometimes may say vendor part local experience agree disturbs pleasant nusa dua 2 accredited vendor per hotel allow sell stuff guest polite relatively discret

On the other hand, if you are a surfer or water sports lover then you will not find theses activities there. Personally, I liked it so so much specially when you compare it with beaches in Legian or Sanur. Legian beach is perfect for surfers while Sanur beach is good for water sports.
